content: In the world of sports, what annual cycling race covers approximately 2,200 miles throughout France and has been held since 1903?

The annual cycling race that covers approximately 2,200 miles throughout France and has been held since 1903 is called the Tour de France. It is one of the most prestigious and famous annual sporting events in the world, often referred to as the "Grand Boucle" in French. The race typically takes place over 23 days in July and consists of 21 stages, with the total distance varying each year but usually around 2,200 miles (3,500 kilometers). The Tour de France is one of the three major annual cycling events, collectively known as the "Grand Tours," alongside the Giro d'Italia and the Vuelta a España.
